reviewText:
Pros:Good story with multiple ending.
Nice Artwork/CG.
Great OST.
About 4~6hours of gameplay, but 6 great hours in my case.
Adjustable difficulty for the boss if you just want to read a good story and kill some mobs.
Forge System.
Upgradable Stat / Skills.
Lightweight (200mo).
Side Quest (Hiding Treasure and more.)
100% Free.

Cons:Keyboard mapped only for qwerty so use alt+shift to switch your setting.
Some joysticks aren't detected.
The default full screen (ALT+enters) is f*cked up, use F5 & F6 instead for fixing this problem.

Final Word:Well, this game was a great surprise, it isn't that long, but the story was pretty good, and I really liked the 3 endings.
As for the fullscreen bug this isn't really a problem with F5/F6 so don't be afraid to download it, play it, and review it!
I currently highly recommend this game to all people.

95/100.

reviewText:
WHAT ARE YOU DOING DOWN HERE? THE GAME IS FREE. JUST GET IT!

...?

You're not sure?

...

You want to read a review anyway?

Fine. Let's do this!

PROS:

+ Simple, fun gameplay.

The core gameplay is simple and easy to pick up. Still it feels rewarding and the various skills and their interactions give the game a unique feel.

+ An above average story.

It's a simple story and you've probably seen it before. Still it's handled well and the endings really help it stand out. All the ending felt unique and despite there being a good" and "bad" ending
date:
all the endings felt like they had their own unique merits.

+ Solid difficulty

Even with maxed out gear the hard mode boss fights were still a solid challenge. Although maxing out your gear will make fighting the normal enemies a joke. Additionally difficulty has no impact on the endings so feel free to grind to the max stats or just set the bosses on easy as you please.

+ Solid Visuals

The pictures above give you a pretty good representation of what the game looks like. Its not a graphical marvel but it's nice to look at. Little things like being able to change the weather in one level and the professionally drawn character art are nice touches as well.

+ A ton of love

Even though it is their first game
recommended: the creator really loved the time he spent on this game and its characters and it shows as you play. Each new skill or boss fight feels unique
hoursPlayed:
and even though we dont get to spend much time with the characters they are all easily likable.

+ Free

The game is of a high enough quality that the guy easily could have asked for a few bucks and the game been easily worth it. A game that asks for nothing but your time and is easily worth it.


CONS:

- Could use a proof reader

The game has some spelling and grammar errors that really stuck out to me. I think they are mostly just due to having only one guy make this and English not being his first language. Honestly
voteText:
the only reason this was even a problem was that I was enjoying the story enough to care about the exact words a character was saying. Still it does draw from the impact of the story a good bit which is a problem since the story's value ways solely on its emotional impact.

- First game the guy made

This shows from time to time with little glitches and two chests that were a little finicky to get. Still overall the game runs great and although i've heard of others experiencing an occasional error I had none myself.

- It doesn't reinvent the wheel

I can sing this game praises for as long as I want (and I wouldn't mind doing just that) but it doesn't change the fact that if you look at it objectively as a game
helpfulPercent: without looking at price or developer experience
votesHelpful:
its a short above average top-down ARPG. I think thats great and believe its a great game that deserves attention but if you need innovation and complexity in your games than this probably isnt for you.


+- Short (about 4~6 hours)

What it says on the tin. Take it how you will.


Overall a great little gem of a game that I think most people could have a good time with.

reviewText:
Pros:Good story with multiple ending.
Nice Artwork/CG.
Great OST.
About 4~6hours of gameplay, but 6 great hours in my case.

100% Free.

Cons:Keyboard mapped only for qwerty so use alt+shift to switch your setting.
Some joysticks aren't detected.
The default full screen (ALT+enters) is f*cked up, use F5 & F6 instead for fixing this problem.

Final Word:Well, this game was a great surprise, it isn't that long, but the story was pretty good, and I really liked the 3 endings.
As for the fullscreen bug this isn't really a problem with F5/F6 so don't be afraid to download it, play it, and review it!
I currently highly recommend this game to all people.

95/100.

reviewText:
Curator Page: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/disastercake#curation

Eternal Senia is like a free sampling of Cake!

A FREE cute, simple, and fun indie turn based strategy RPG where you control one character.  The game took me about 4 or 5 hours to beat to 100% completion, though I did take a sneak peak at some guides near the end to figure out the rest of the treasure hiding places.

StoryEternal Senia delivers a story about a younger sister searching for her older sister in a mysterious power.  Over the course of the game, the player is taken to several varying landscapes as the background and the characters unfolds through flashbacks.

GameplayThe game is a turn based strategy style where you control your single character and bump" into enemies to exchange blows with them.  There are occasions where some strong enemy skills are telegraphed and you have time to avoid them.

There's several pieces of puzzle variety that progress in difficulty
date: but none get very complex.\n\nThere are several large bosses that vary in fighting styles
recommended:
each with its own types of challenges to overcome.

There are NPCs at the end of each level that help track how much of a completionist you are so you can do the OCD hunting!

Likes
IT'S FREE!
Polished controls and gameplay.
There are some well structured goals and completions.
Multiple endings.
Likable characters.
Well structured goals.
Puzzle
hoursPlayed: level
voteText:
and enemy variety.
Difficulty level options on bosses.
Variety in boss fight mechanics.
Cute visuals.
Completionist tracking and motivational reward system.
Equipment upgrades through a simple item grind crafting system.
Dislikes
No steam achievements.
Very little variety in the way of main story NPCs.
The balance on the hardest difficulty does not seem to be ironed out (but that may be by design).
SummaryEternal Senia is not the most robust RPG experience
helpfulPercent: but what it delivers is polished and fun.  For delivering several hours of enjoyment it's definitely worth more than the free price that it's offered at!"

reviewText:
Hello everyone this is my first ever review!

First of all get ready for a feels train. I started playing this game just because I saw a free game with extrmely good ratings. Lets just say I got a lot more than I bargined for. The pixel stle gives off an old vibe but there's high quality pictures for when it counts.

Gameplay:
Actually this game is super easy. It has a simple skill and attack system that anyone can use.
Farming in this game is also super easy. The variety of drops that are availible don't change. At all. It pretty much just changes the color and the name of the item.

Now lets talk about the soundtrack in this game. One word. Phenomenal. It fits super well with all the bosses and the regular levels. I wouldn't download it to listen to for leisure but I definitley love playing the game with it.

What's nice is that theres three endings. I take that back. Not nice. Hold on, I need to cry in that corner over there remembering the stuff this game put me through. But yeah, it is a nice simple game that I believe, if it had better graphics and had a little bit more diverse crafting menu would definitley be a paid game.

Last warning. Your boarding a feels train without knowing it. Get the game.

reviewText:
I'd be lying if I called this game a masterpiece, but for what it is, it's good. I got all 3 endings in a single sitting (from the moment I started playing) since I got invested in the story and characters. The gameplay is simplistic enough to get into quickly, with just enough spice thrown into the boss fights that you'll lose if you're reckless, but otherwise it's easy to get into and enjoy.

The biggest gripe I do have is of course, the script. It clearly wasn't originally written in english, and the translation wasn't exactly great. It's still easy enough to know what's going on, but it was just that little bit too much that really stopped me from getting as into it as I could have. I feel like perhaps some characterization may have been lost in translation, as well.

Still. It's free. And because it's free, I wholeheartedly recommend it. I admit I wouldn't if it was a full price title, but I've paid for worse, so take that as you will.

reviewText: This game is something that I would consider a nice example for RPG Maker games to move forward upon.  It is very appealing with a beautiful story about sister-relationships.  While I was playing this game, I was only having enjoyment.  For example, a game is done right if a person is having fun trying to get the best equipment.  In case I haven't stated it enough, I highly recommend people to give this game a try as it only brought me joy.  The story is beautiful, the gameplay is easy to play as well as fun, the visuals are nice to look at, and the audio is great too.  The main downsides I would mention is if the story interesting to you (this game is story-heavy) or if you find it too easy/hard (there are harder/easier difficulties to play with though).  Either way, I think a person considering this game should still give it a shot.\n\nP.S. I understand this is a brief review, but I feel like it gives off my general attitude towards the game.

reviewText:
Eternal Senia takes RPG Maker to a whole new level.
Even with so many inspirations and references from other games, Eternal Senia manages to be a unique game.

It has a very complex (in terms of coding/scripting) and yet simple (in terms of gameplay) combat system that is extremely well done. It's so addicting that even farming for crafting materials is fun and enjoyable.

Its crafting system is great as well. It's just a bit repetitive, because it is the same set of weapons/armors every dungeon. Only, of course, with different names, statuses, etc. I think it would be nice if it had a recipe drop system, in which you needed to find the recipes for the gear you want to craft. But don't get me wrong, it's great the way it is!

The story is immersive and deeply emotional. I don't like comparisons but, it is as emotional as the story in To the Moon.

In conclusion, Eternal Senia is a great game that you should be playing right now! It's easily one of the best RPG Maker games out there.

If you, Holy Priest, think that your game made me want to play Ragnarok Online again after years, well, you're right! But I'm not going back to that, just thinking about killing one million Loli Ruris to level up makes me sad...
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
For a free RPG Maker Game, this is amazing. For the producer's first game, this is brilliant!

For RO fans such as myself, although Egnigem and Margaretha are in the game, this is a completely different game from RO altogether, but very few RO references. However, that doesn't mean that the game is bad.

This game is originally made in Chinese, and translated to English, so there's some bits of Engrish here and there. The CGs in the game are absolutely beautiful, and the gameplay is very simple, but still fun. The game's strong point would be the story, and as the other reviewers mentioned, the story is quite good.

If there is a sequel coming, I really hope to see more of the story, like more on Senia's backstory, since we know enough of Magaleta. There's so much things about Senia we don't know, and I doubt we explored the entire tower.

For casual players who loves simple gameplay, give this a try!

reviewText:
First off, this game is amazing. And is worth anyones time. (It's free! Just do it!).
Now, time for some Pros and Cons
Pros:
- It's free. It's an amazing, free, game. No DLC, either.
- Very easy combat system, welcoming to anyone.
- The Skills, Craft, and Equipment system are very well done, and keeps you checking on your charactor.
- Encourages you to explore, and find hidden things.
- Amazing Artwork! Just love it.
- The OST in this game is also amazing, highly recomened listening to it even if you don't decide to play.
- The Story/Plot is very interesting, and sad. It will always leave you wanting to know what happends next.
- There are multiple endings.
Cons:
- Noticible grammar problems, only a few, though.
- The only options availible are Sound, and fullscreen on/off. No option to stop me from crying.
- The Occasional bug or two, no biggy.
- OST Kept on switching when I wanted to listen to it. :c
- Developer didn't add me on steam.

Overall, I think anyone, and everyone should at least give this game a try. Also, you can see how passionate the developer is about the game, and despite all the hard work he put into it, he made it free!

10/10, would have paid to play this game.

reviewText:
First off, this game is amazing. And is worth anyones time. (It's free! Just do it!).
Now, time for some Pros and Cons
Pros:
- It's free. It's an amazing, free, game. No DLC, either.
- Very easy combat system, welcoming to anyone.
- The Skills, Craft, and Equipment system are very well done, and keeps you checking on your charactor.
- Encourages you to explore, and find hidden things.
- Amazing Artwork! Just love it.
- The OST in this game is also amazing, highly recomened listening to it even if you don't decide to play.
- The Story/Plot is very interesting, and sad. It will always leave you wanting to know what happends next.
- There are multiple endings.
Cons:
- Noticible grammar problems, only a few, though.
- The only options availible are Sound, and fullscreen on/off. No option to stop me from crying.
- The Occasional bug or two, no biggy.
- OST Kept on switching when I wanted to listen to it. :c
- Developer didn't add me on steam.

Overall, I think anyone, and everyone should at least give this game a try. Also, you can see how passionate the developer is about the game, and despite all the hard work he put into it, he made it free!

10/10, would have paid to play this game.

reviewText:
Eternal Senia is a free ARPG (action rpg, meaning the combat is not turn based) made in RPG maker. The game was simple but quite fun while it lasted. For a game that's 100% free, there's really no reason not to try it.

Pros:
+Great soundtrack. Admittedly it's small and loops a lot, but the game is free, so I can't complain.
+Gameplay is simple but sucks you in. Nothing too complicated here, this is a relaxation game. (Except for the final boss, which is unexpectedly difficult.) Just touch enemies to auto-attack. There's also a set of special skills that consume a magic meter.
+Touching story
+Character art is scant but what's there is excellent. It looks much better than most doujinsoft on Steam. Almost professional level.
+I got eight hours of gameplay out of it

Cons:
-Final boss is MUCH harder than the rest of the bosses; it feels slightly unbalanced with the rest of the game.

This game was better than a lot of games you have to pay for. I think the creator could have easily gotten away with charging $2.99 for it; people would still have loved it.

reviewText:
Eternal Senia is a Pokémon gameboy-esque game but without the Pokémon and instead replaces Ash with a purple haired fighter named Senia who battles for her life to essentially rescue her sister.

This game is very good if you like simple 2-D adventure games.

On the other hand, I'd argue that this game is a bit simple on many levels. Fighting mechanics are a bit uninteresting; you just walk up to an enemy with the arrow keys and it automatically attacks, not much more than that.

However, I recommend this game to you as it's free to play and is perfect if you have free time to kill (quite literally) and have an interest in playing the role of a strong, yet somewhat sad/worried female character.

If you really liked this game and want to support the developer further, you can do so in this link below.

reviewText:
Eternal Senia was a very good surprise for me, the gameplay is very simple anyone can learn it within a few seconds, I feel like it's an essential point since a game is made to have fun.

The plot is also rather simple but is quite entertaining and you may find yourself wonder how it ends.

The length of the game, this game is rather short 6-7 hours to end it, it's a good point since it doesn't bore you with unnecessary text, battle or content.

The art is good, all mobs and monsters are nicely design, most of them are very well drawn and suit perfectly the action and the universe. The number of artworks and where they are display is also well calculated it doesn't flood you at all but they are there when they are needed.

The characters, there is no superficial and useless character, the author just introduce the perfect number of characters to have all of them developed enough. Despite the feelings of the main characters a bit naive and childish sometimes they share very strong feelings well described by the text.

The sounds are excellent, I really enjoyed each of them, they suit pefectly the mood and the universe, only the first one is a bit too rocky for the place in which we listen to it.

The gameplay, this the best advantage of this game but also it worst drawback, the gameplay being easy it's really fun to play the game but when you are doing all the sidequests and starting to think about the game it gets really really easy to beat all the mobs. Mini boss is just spell spam. Bosses remain rather challenging. Despite the spells being usefull and funs, there is some really balance issue with them some are too strong some are nearly useless. Last thing the game isn't for controller buttons by default are really poorly or not configured.

I higly recommed to give a try to Eternal Senia, but you should take the game how is it that is to say a fun game, no try hards, no theory crafting if you are able to do so you'll find a very fun and enjoyable game.

reviewText:
If you haven't tried this game already, I suggest giving it a shot. It's free, anyways.

The game is an action RPG that only uses the keyboard. The description didn't lie when it stated that the controls are simple. Arrow keys to move around, QWER to use the four skills. Oh, and attacking doesn't involve any button- all you have to do is walk into enemies to attack. There's also a lot of puzzles in the game. They're simple to do and they're all different, so they're all fun to do.

In terms of difficulty, the game was a bit on the easy side. After upgrading items, normal mobs quickly become one-hit-kills, so for an experienced gamer, killing normal mobs becomes somewhat tedious. There's an option to increase the difficulty of boss fights, so boss fights were still fun and intense. There's also an option to decrease the difficulty in the event that you find yourself stuck on a boss.

Next, the story and characters. The game explores the main characters quite well and gradually reveals their pasts throughout the story. It gets really emotional at some points in the story, as well. Oh, and there are three endings, by the way, each one very touching. There are quite a few grammar mistakes in the dialogue, but if you can ignore them, then it shouldn't take too much of the story.

The music and sound fit really fit the atmosphere of the game. For the brighter, happier places, there's upbeat music. For the creepy places, there's creepy music. And for the more emotionally dark spots, sad music. The sound effects are pretty typical, but they fit well into the game.

Lastly, the graphics. The game uses a pixelart style. For the most part, it looks good, but in a few places, there are mismatching tiles. It isn't too bad, though. The cutscenes are nicely animated and the CGs look really beautiful. I would love to download the CGs as wallpapers!

Despite its flaws, the game is very good, especially since it's free. If it actually cost money, I would buy it without hesitation. Definitely try this game out!

reviewText:
Quick analysis:

Story: 2/10
Senia goes into the Tower of Eternity to save her sister Magaleta. That's literally it.
No memorable villains/side characters.

Gameplay: 4/10
Battle is a barebones YS Origins styled combat with some skills.
Said skills are a Front Line teleport hit (up to 8 tiles), 3x2 Front AoE, 9 tile front piercing ranged attack, All Around Point Blank AoE - the only one with a cooldown and massive damage.
Skills use MP (20, 20, 10, 40, not listed in game) and you can use SP (gained from killing enemies ogether with EXP) to improve them.

Leveling system is as basic as it gets. Level Up = More stats.

The crafting system is really simple and does not vary between the whole 4 dungeons.
For each armor piece and your weapon, you can craft 4 tiers of gear per dungeon.
You collect the base materials from the dungeon enemies, which enables the first 2 tiers.
An extra material from the midboss in each dungeon for the tier 3 gear, and the last material from the King" version of common enemies
date:
for the final piece of gear for the dungeon.
Each tier needs the item from the last one.

Dungeon design is pretty linear with small puzzles and some skill usage here and there. There are only around 12 rooms in the whole game that are optional. At the end of each dungeon
recommended: there are some NPCs with rewards for # kill for each enemy type
hoursPlayed: getting all chests
voteText: and crafting all tier 4 gear.\n\nItems are there just for crafting or for a small stat boost
helpfulPercent: limited per dungeon. There is no currency.\n\nThere are multiple endings
votesHelpful: but they aren't missable. You can get to all of them from the last save point.\n\nSave points are also pretty abundant
votesTotal: and most dub as warp points too.\n\nIt's worth noting that most enemies don't attack at all
votesFunny: or even do great damage on contact
commentsCount: making this game way too easy. Even bosses are hard pressed to be a challenge. Even in hard mode (you can choose whether the boss will be easy
column16: regular or hard before each fight. Difficulty only modifies enemy stats).\n\nI didn't die even once
column17: even fighting all bosses on hard mode
column18:
with no external aid/guides etc.

Music / Sound FX: 6/10

Pleasant but short music tracks. Some of them are really misplaced in some scenes though.
They are also very cool and you may find yourself humming them in your head :)
Sound effects are pretty good.

Graphics: 8/10

Great sprites
column19: decent UI even if lacking some info
column20:
overall great assets in dungeons.

Overall: 9/10

One of the best free RPG games i've ever played. It could be the pre-alpha version of a legendary ARPG. All it needs is improvement in the main lacking areas and a lot of polish / QA.

It's worth mentioning that it wouldn't get half that score if it was a commercial ($10+) game though.

Kudos to the author
column21: who pretty much created this by himself

reviewText:
It's a nice little and simple Action RPG, which can keep you amused for a few hours. In fact it have everything a good Action RPG should have: art, story, controls, combat system, music and even a couple of secrets, including two secret endings. The only bad parts is a game being too short and optional mid-bosses have literally no AI (and that is not an exaggeration). So, download it, play it and wait in hope for Eternal Senia 2.

BTW, both main heroines are inspired by Ragnarok Online.

Also, to play in fullscreen use F5 and F6 instead of Alt+Enter and don't leap through doors with Q to avoid various bugs.

reviewText:
[WARNING] THIS GAME HAS FEELS, AND THE FEELS ARE AMAZING AND SAD.[/warning]

This game is a fantastic one. The game features Senia, a girl looking for his Sister Magaleta and travels through the Tower of Eternity. The game captures emotion at its finest and you will feel as if you're watching a movie -- Interactive that is. While there is a fantastic story, the combat also makes up for it. Classic RPG fans will recognize what this is from and realize how epic, and honestly, how easy the game is to control! With how good of a game this is, and being a FIRST game for the creator Holy Priest, I would have to give it 10/10... The music is amazing, the graphics are spritey and very nice! I also wish I could give more of a review, but playing the game can only fill what I cannot say. So what're you waiting for? PLAY THE GAME.

reviewText:
Not all stories need to have a happy conclusion. Personally, I believe the third ending was fantastic (If you haven't witnessed this ending, do it now. Seriously, it was deeply emotional and was a great way to lead into a sequel if there ever is one). This game brought out emotions that are seemingly rare nowadays — a mixture of fear, hate, depression, happiness. Deep emotions that I haven't felt since I played Gears of War 3 for the first time.

If there was anything I would change, it would have to be the combat. Excluding the bosses, it was quite simplistic in design. Offering no sense of difficulty throughout the entirety of the game. If there is a sequel in the works, I would suggest refining what you have now and make it better, while still maintaining emphasis on story; that would be ♥♥♥♥ing great.

I do have to admit, I really enjoyed the crafting system. While it lacked in complexity, it made up for me wanting to get the best gear I could before advancing to the next dungeon, simply to get that reward from the Legendary Sheep. Also, while on the subject, I loved the three NPCs located at the end of each dungeon. Yeah, the ones that had set milestones for the player to achieve, and in return for their time, granting the player items such as the components to reforge the Hydrangea Sword and Violet Crystal Armor, which broke during the first portion of the game.

Overall, I thought the game was lovely. While lacking in gameplay and length, it did give me a good five hours of enjoyment. I'd recommend this game to anyone so long as you have the time. It's an enjoyable experience. Also, it's free, so why not play it? (Play the game. Do it now.)

reviewText: Good Game
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Billed appropriately as a relaxing and pleasurable experience with simple and easily grasped gameplay, Eternal Senia is a short and yet original and emotive ARPG built by one Taiwanese developer using RPG Maker software.  Its originality comes in the touching and yet somewhat tragic dynamic between the titular deuteragonist - and main playable character - Senia and her older non-playable 'sister', Magaleta.  Whilst the cadence of the written English in the game is a little stilted and awkward due to translational grammatical errors, the potency of the dynamic between the two 'sisters' comes through very lucidly.  If I were to recommend this game, it would primarily be for that reason.

The combat system is a slight revamp of styles similar to Illusion of Gaia or Terranigma.  Enemy sprites are ran into and auto-attacked will, for the most part, counter-attack.  Four skills are learned throughout the game, and all of them have at least one area of optimal use (though the first two of these four skills in general have more global utility).  The bosses, whilst somewhat samey in the mechanics used (e.g. regular use of shield gems, shaded area spells, mob spawning, horizontal or vertical beams), do get harder as the fight progresses, and the last fight on Hard Mode is legitimately quite difficult.  There perhaps aren't as many special/unique enemies like the ghosts or the nuns as there could have been, and a flaw to the giant regular enemies is that they never try to initiate attacks so can always be beaten with patience alone.

There are three main zones to travel through and it's an elegant touch that some comic/trivial NPCs offer perks for fully completing these areas.  This primarily involves quota-killing NPCs for books that permanently boost the Evasion stat, finding all the treasure chests in an area, and crafting the best armour for that area.  Whilst the crafting will require some grinding, it never gets too tedious.  The Demon Frontier is the most interesting from an overall design perspective - the Wisdom area in the castle was probably my favourite individual section of the game - but the Sanctum is the most visually interesting area and has a couple of nice touches related to the game's plot.

My main critique of the level design would be that all levels are very, very linear, and with the Waypoint mechanic enabling teleportation between specific save points, it didn't really necessarily need to be so.  Often, a large appeal to ARPGs is that certain areas are unravelled and fully bloom over time, and only in the first area of the Sanctum and for completion is backtracking at all necessary.  The difficulty isn't quite tuned right, even though it is billed as an easy game, since if one keeps up on gear the second area and third area (up until the last boss) are actually both easier to clear through than the first.  Having said that, the option to take on bosses in hard mode was appreciated, and approach rather than level grinding always wins out on the bosses, which is good.

The music is fine and fitting to its surroundings, and whilst the visuals in general are a bit generic, it's understandable given the use of RPG Maker, although the few pieces of Senia/Magaleta artwork are nice.  The more minor characters are mostly a little cheesy, and whilst I'd prefer they had a little more texture, the Senia/Magaleta dynamic makes up for it.

Oh, and it's free.

tl;dr - If you want a throwback to the SNES-style ARPGs with a poignant and touching story and simple, straightforward gameplay, this game is for you!

reviewText:
When one has truly experienced a good story they are left with a sense of emptiness upon finally reaching the end. Throughout the story, you've come to know the characters. You've gone on an adventure with them, only to be violently ripped back into reality. It's as if they, as well as the time you spent with them, never existed in the first place. It's really saying something when a 2-3 hour long game is immersive and memorable enough to do something like this.


-Story 9/10-

My only complaint is how short/lacking in content it is. The entirety of it takes place in the Tower of Eternity where the protagonist, Senia, is looking for her sister who ventured into it. The Tower of Eternity is supposedly very dangerous after all. As far as the setting of it goes, there just isn't much. We don't even know anything about the outside world.

Okay that aside, how about that sisterly love? Seriously, this is some tear-jerking ♥♥♥♥. The story between Senia and her sister Magaleta is probably what got me so hooked. It's tragic but beautiful at the same time.


-Combat 9/10-

For a classic-style RPG, the combat is quite nice albeit repetitive and beyond easy. It's a nice change of pace from turn-based encounters in most other games. Unfortunately, there are only 4 skills in the game, two of which are actually useful. You'll mostly be using Q to do damage and R when it's up to nuke bosses. That's about it. There's not much diversity, but then again there isn't enough game to really justify going further in depth in this department.


-Music 10/10-

Some really beautiful stuff here. The only BGM that I felt didn't fit was right at the start of the game. Everything else was perfect. On top of that, all the sound files are sitting loose in the game folder. Free music too! :D

-Art 9/10-

For an indie RPG of this caliber, the sprites are quite well made. The larger bosses had a lot of effort put into their art. The only con I can think of is how some of the bosses attacks kinda seem like the don't link up very well to the sprites. An example would be the giant lasers on s few of them.



Seriously, just get it. Knock it out in a few hours. You've got nothing to lose!

(Except for a few thousand tears)

I'm still bawling my eyes out from ending 3.

reviewText:
An action RPG seemingly made in some RPG Maker variant that has surprisingly tight controls. Plays kind of like Ys, I suppose, though I'm not the expert on Ys or anything - it's just that same 'running into enemies' sort of combat. Feels like it'd be better without the engine limitations. Only three dungeons, sadly. Feels a bit Android-y, if you've ever played mobile action RPGs.

A very sweet story with two very loving sisters! It's free, it's short, the author goes out of their way to make things easy on you, there's a hard mode for the bosses if you want. Give it a shot!

By the way, if you're reading this, Luna, the Facebook code is 1215. Now you don't need to go on Facebook!

reviewText:
2¢ Review

Game Name:	Eternal Senia					 Original Release: 	18 Jun 2015				  My Overall Grade (#/10):  		7		  Demo:  	No					  Workshop:  No						  Level Editor:  No						  Captions:  	No					  Controller Support: No					  Multiplayer:  		No				  VR Support:  		No				  Steam Cards  / Achieves:  No / No				  VAC:  	No						  Genre:  		JRPG, RPGMaker					  Manual:  		No					  Metacritic Score:	N/A				  Full Audio Multi Language:  		No		  Win 10 / Crapple / Linux:  	Yes / No / No			  Recommended To:  	JRPG fans, RPGMaker fans, RPG fans				  Other:
5¢ Review Pro:
Free
Good Story
Low System Specs

Con:
No Video options
RPGMaker game

Overall:
5/10 +2 free +1 story -1 lack of video options = 7/10

OK I'm not a huge fan of RPGMaker games. 10 million very similar games with nominal extra effort put in to create more than a nominal story and they still want to charge a hefty price.

This is different.  A full story. More than a nomial upgrade on the RPGMaker package. And it's taken a novel approach .. free but donations.

If your looking to start getting into playing JRPG or RPGMaker games, this is the one to start with.

Game Name:	Eternal Senia					 Original Release: 	18 Jun 2015				  My Overall Grade (#/10):  		7		  Demo:  	No					  Workshop:  No						  Level Editor:  No						  Captions:  	No					  Controller Support: No					  Multiplayer:  		No				  VR Support:  		No				  Steam Cards  / Achieves:  No / No				  VAC:  	No						  Genre:  		JRPG, RPGMaker					  Manual:  		No					  Metacritic Score:	N/A				  Full Audio Multi Language:  		No		  Win 10 / Crapple / Linux:  	Yes / No / No			  Recommended To:  	JRPG fans, RPGMaker fans, RPG fans				  Other:
5¢ Review Pro:
Free
Good Story
Low System Specs

Con:
No Video options
RPGMaker game

Overall:
5/10 +2 free +1 story -1 lack of video options = 7/10

OK I'm not a huge fan of RPGMaker games. 10 million very similar games with nominal extra effort put in to create more than a nominal story and they still want to charge a hefty price.

This is different.  A full story. More than a nomial upgrade on the RPGMaker package. And it's taken a novel approach .. free but donations.

If your looking to start getting into playing JRPG or RPGMaker games, this is the one to start with.

reviewText:
This game is the best I have played in a while.  I would recommend this to everyone, even my dog. (I played through all three endings in one day because I couldn't stop)

+ rewards farming (if you take the time to get the best equipment to can easily become invincible, if you want to of course)

- the ONE remotely negitive thing I can think to say about this game it that it is played with the arrow keys and not wasd"
which makes it awkward to control at first but is easy to get used to


note: The english translation it slightly incorrect at times but it is still easy to understand.

reviewText:
After completely playing throught he game ezcluding the bonus room I have to say this is got to be one of my all time favorite games. The gameplay is amazing if you are into rpg styled leveling and grinding and the abilitys give you a bit of variety near the end of the game, along with a crafting system ,and a arcane area in certain levels for grinding loot.
The story is phenomenel it conveys emotion and can really give you the feels better than most triple A titles out there but be warned if you dont like somewhat sad storys you will probably not like this game. The music is another thing that really impressed me it felt like a piano being played in the background only sorta in a 8 bit form which goes along with the graphics which triggered a lot of nostalgia from when i was younger playing games like pokemon.
The translation from japanese to english isn't perfect and there was the very rare instance it would go back to japanese characters but that problem went away a little after the begining.
In my opinion this is one of the best games i have seen so far and it conveys the story so well it makes a lot of triple A games look terrible, i would highly reccomend this to anyone who likes a story driven game or rpgs.

reviewText:
A heart-warming simple story about a younger sister trying to find her older sister.

Great gameplay, good story, about 5 hours... and it's free!
The music on the intro screen is the only one that I really noticed, the rest is kinda just in the background.
One of the main things that turned me onto this was hearing that it doesn't follow the standard turn-based attack system that RPG maker uses... and I have to say, this new system is amazingly awesome.

Mixed feelings about the super hax boss. (I did set it to hard)

Things I wish were different...
The enemies are for farming and to slow you down.
The bosses were the only ones to present a real challenge, and I fought every boss on hard mode. Which was still pretty easy.
Minor: If you have the item equipped, it should still be upgradeable.
Minor: I think the volume was fluctuating at times.
Minor: Achievements. I felt like the game very much encouraged exploration with the 3 NPC next to the boss room. Why not have achievements as well for doing it?

XBOX controller... oh lord. There's no remap option. Keyboard is required. I ended up coding a dirty redirect for my controller.
For others: I used autoit, xinput, and I made Y and A my other 2 powers. This did not interfere with any of the other buttons.

reviewText: For a free to play game, this provided me with quite an enjoyable time.  A decently easy and straightforth game, Eternal Senia is definitly a game worth trying out.  The combat in the game is simple as an ARPG but you also get some special abilities to use for not just combat but for unlicking distant things as well.  The combat in the beginning is beyond easy (e.g. the first slime boss) but does get a little harder but never too hard so long as you aren't rushing to bosses.  As I went and tried to complete most everything before getting to the boss (all chests, all legendary, monster quota), playing on the hardest difficulty for a boss wasn't really even that hard once you figured out the attack pattern, which are pretty similar for every boss.  The story was pretty good and understandable and overall a good game.  This is the kind of game I probably would have bought had it gone on sale for a cheap price during the steam summer sale.\n\nRating: 8.6/10

reviewText: Was a very fun game to play. I enjoyed it a lot. The combat was good, the controls were simple. I appreciate the fact they guided the character through with the controls, unlike a few other games I've played with the same type of window etc. Completed the game in about 7-8 hours. The endings were great. It's fulfilling when you manage to get all three of them.The CGs are amazing and beautifully done. The details done for every character and scene is really breathtaking. I appreciate the effort the creators put into the game and the way they twist the storyline in many ways. Definitely recommended for others to play.

reviewText: I love this game, the story, the gameplay, the characters, everything. It's what I like to call short and sweet like a piece of candy, it's amazing when you first try it, it doesn't overstay it's welcome and it left me wanting more just like it. It had some minor problems like the grammar, but with alittle polishing, that all can be fixed. I sincerely hope the creator makes more stories because to be honest this one made me cry alittle at two parts. (I won't state which parts to prevent spoilers and to be honest it might be because I'm just a big crybaby.) All in all, it was a very good game with a very good story with very likable characters. I rate this game 10/10 because the grammar even with my OCD was not a problem at all for me so if you love anime and touching little stories I recommend you play this right away.

The producer/developer needs to be funded, so that their talents can be fully used to make other games, though a sequel or an extension of Eternal Senia would be nice...

reviewText: For a free to play game, this provided me with quite an enjoyable time.  A decently easy and straightforth game, Eternal Senia is definitly a game worth trying out.  The combat in the game is simple as an ARPG but you also get some special abilities to use for not just combat but for unlicking distant things as well.  The combat in the beginning is beyond easy (e.g. the first slime boss) but does get a little harder but never too hard so long as you aren't rushing to bosses.  As I went and tried to complete most everything before getting to the boss (all chests, all legendary, monster quota), playing on the hardest difficulty for a boss wasn't really even that hard once you figured out the attack pattern, which are pretty similar for every boss.  The story was pretty good and understandable and overall a good game.  This is the kind of game I probably would have bought had it gone on sale for a cheap price during the steam summer sale.\n\nRating: 8.6/10

reviewText: Was a very fun game to play. I enjoyed it a lot. The combat was good, the controls were simple. reviewText: I love this game, the story, the gameplay, the characters, everything. It's what I like to call short and sweet like a piece of candy, it's amazing when you first try it, it doesn't overstay it's welcome and it left me wanting more just like it. It had some minor problems like the grammar, but with alittle polishing, that all can be fixed. I sincerely hope the creator makes more stories because to be honest this one made me cry alittle at two parts. (I won't state which parts to prevent spoilers and to be honest it might be because I'm just a big crybaby.) All in all, it was a very good game with a very good story with very likable characters. I rate this game 10/10 because the grammar even with my OCD was not a problem at all for me so if you love anime and touching little stories I recommend you play this right away.

reviewText: Well I'm not confident in giving a review to such a beautiful game but anyways, the game is somewhat short, free, emotional, and pretty easy now that I think about it. I didn't even care about the combat system, it is nice though, that I can agree. At first I didn't think it would work so well but it definitly works well. I beat the game then recorded gameplay since at the end it does say it's fine to spread your gameplay, sadly no one can see me nearly cry since I could only record gameplay only. Nearly crying means that if I were not so good at not really caring and ignoring pain, I would cry for weeks maybe months, perhaps years. You can really just finish the game in at least two hours I'd say, spent nearly half a day recording but yeah it's that short. Again this game is free and a really great game and it's really funny in my opinion to find Chinese writing I assume in the English version.\n\nNow this game is so well done that when I see it in my library I almost cry at the sight of it, also Senia is cute. Well in my opinion and that's all I really have to say about it for now.

reviewText:
First off all i gotta say i absolutely loved this game and i recommend it for people that like sad and moving stories.

Now lets start.

Pros:

-Very interesting and moving story

-Good charecter design

-Good level design

-nearly 0 bugs in the game(except that some text is still in japanese and wasnt translated! Example is when you exame the teddy bear twice in senia's sister's room=

-Very cool and challenging boss fights that at the same time can be beginer friendly on easy mode or exper friendly on hard mode

Cons

-Bad ending simulator

-A few parts are not translated

-There are just not enough items to satisfy the average rpg player

I give this game a 9/10 (not 10 because there are no good endings.... i now feel empty because the story is too sad! even in the best ending you can get which is ending #3 : Eternal determination) Wait that ending kinda sounds like undertale doesn it?

On a side note:~

Wanna know how to get creeped out in this game?

Step 1: Unlock eternity burst skill (the one when you press R and everyone around you dies)

Step 2: Use it anywhere

Step 3: Quickly press x and look at your character's eyes

reviewText: It's a short game(5.4 hours for me, including the 10-ish minutes I spent in the bonus room) that has active combat (bumping into enemies to hit them), diverse bosses, and a neat little story(with 3 different endings) that borders on sisterly love without being over-the-top. Its english isn't the best but the developer clearly isn't skilled in speaking/writing English so fair enough and it's also free. Oh, did I mention that? A 5 hour game that is great at killing a few hours and it is *free*. Now, it's not so simple as It's free so it's good". The specifics that you need to know are the usual ones. I'll list them in seperate paragraphs to make it at least a little organized.\n\nThe story is

reviewText:
So I only found out about this game about 6.2 hours ago (I know because I finished the last ending after 6.1 hours of play)

The author said that a driving philosophy for his game design process is that games shouldn't be complicated or difficult. Of course I don't agree with this in general. But I could feel his design decision throughout the game. I don't think I ever felt confused or frustrated.

The music, gameplay, and art were topnotch.

It didn't overstay its welcome. And it had a progression system in game that felt absolutely perfect. Was very fun to complete everything there was to do in the game.

The story was good too. There is talk of a sequel.

reviewText:
This is a more standardized RPGMaker game.
Despite the trashy look/feel of the game, it actually has a somewhat decent plot and decent to good music.

You can't really complain too much about free games, and I feel like if they advanced this game into a series and worked harder on the core system that it could be a fairly decent story/series.

If you're a fan of decent stories and can overlook the RPGMaker styled gameplay, then it's worth the play.
Fair Warning, a small amount of grinding might be nessecary per area(very small)
For the most part, I spent maybe.. 5 to 10 extra minutes grinding up materials to make each set?

Another thing to take in, is that this game is not a long game by any standards.
I believe it took me roughly 2 nights to 100% / get all the endings.

Enjoy.

reviewText:
The gameplay is pretty grindy and linear--the player walks through a non-branching series of hallways and repeats rooms until gathering enough of whatever resource to get the desired upgrade. There is a live action combat mechanic and the rooms contain puzzles, but the controls are awkward: picking up unintended inputs and not clearly communicating to the player when input is being locked out.

The majority of the upgrades only provide differences in scale, and many become locked behind Points of No Return later. The story is a bit contrived, relying most on exposition and character monologue, rather than expressing any of that to the player through gameplay or character interaction.

To be fair, many of these weaknesses are actually weaknesses inherent to the RPG Maker engine, but knowing that doesn't make the game fun in its own right.

If you just play games for the action, you will like this game, otherwise, if you're wanting a satisfying story, then I don't recommend, as you will not enjoy.

reviewText:
This is a fine game but it is overrated.  Based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews I was expecting a masterpiece.  The game mechanics are simple but at times can be fun.  The story is basic and not nearly as amazing as the positive reviews led me to believe.  The character designs are very beautiful and the music is good.

The main reason I give it a thumbs down is due to the lack of polish in the user interface.  You start the game and there is nothing telling you what keys to use to move or even how to accept or cancel.  It's very ackward for the first few minutes.  There is also a bug where two types of gems show up with the same name and you are left wondering why you can't build certain items eventhough the gem is in your inventory.  Some of the boss enemies sit there not doing anything. You hit them until your health goes down, then get some space, wait for health to regenerate, hit them some more, then repeat.

It's an average game given that is is free but I could have spent my time playing something better.
voteText: 14 of 48 people (29%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
You might think that the central mechanic of walking your character into monsters makes the game boring.

Ironically, that isn't really the problem.

If you have ever played any of the Ys games, this is fundamentally a dumbed-down version of those games with much less dynamic moment-to-moment gameplay.

On top of that, the game was originally written in Japanese, then translated into English... and while the translation is never non-sensical, it is obvious that it was not translated by a native speaker.

But even beyond that... the story just isn't very interesting at all. You're a girl who has lost her sister. You need to go find her. You run into... some people along the way. None of them are very interesting or memorable, nor is the protagonist, for that matter. There is just nothing gripping about the story of this game.

Given the very simplistic, not very rewarding gameplay and the unrewarding story, there is just no reason to play this game. It isn't terrible, but lots of things aren't terrible; for something to be worth your time, it should be actively good.

This is not.

Your time is better spent doing other things. Read a book instead; it will be much more fulfilling. Or play a better game.

Eternal Senia also has a bonus room - a behind the scenes" of sorts - where the developer shares his thoughts about the enemies

reviewText:
Don't get me wrong. It's an ok game for free, especially if you like jrpgs.
But it definitely is not good enough to be one of the top rated on steam.

The combat system is quite interesting, but the gameplay itself is just grind->craft->boss->grind->craft->boss...Big Boss.
Nothing more.
Plot is nothing special, but what ruins it is horrible, horrible writing. The dialogue lines are so pathetic and naive as if written by a 10-year old for a class test. I do not see any possibility to get engaged in the game because of that. I still wonder whether those positive reviewers praising the plot and claiming they have cried are not making fun of me (I'm new to steam, maybe it's some kind of community joke to give this game positive reviews?).
Music is simple, boring and repetitive (only a few good moments).
The graphics... well what do you expect?

Really, nothing special in this game.

column18: and now my character gets possessed and is going to stay here forever? So why did I even come here?!"\n\nThere. That's one of the endings. Now you don't have to play through this game to find out. Also
column19: I've heard that the other two endings are just as bad. The game gave me hints afterwards about how to get the other endings
column21: I was just so fed up with it that I closed the game without even bothering with the hints.\n\nI could name half a dozen JRPGs off the top of my head that do their job better Eternal Senia
column22: so I have to wonder why this game got a 98% positive rating. Just click "Next in Queue" or whatever
column23: and find something worth your time."

reviewText:
Man, I was just about to give this game a positive review, but then I finished it. The game's short so I'll just make a few points:

Point number 1: Okay, lets get the good one out of the way. The characters in this game are quite nice. I like their design and their personalities (even if a coward using a two-handed sword as her weapon of choice strikes me as a little odd). I empathized with pretty much every line in the game; even if I didn't agree with all of them, I could at least see where they were coming from and that made it rather enjoyable. For a story-based game, that's usually enough to recommend it. however...

Point number 2: A bit spoiler-y but,  None of your choices mean ANYTHING until the last fight/choice. Senia is characterized as both loving and relying on her older sister, so I decided to make it so that I always had her sister's pendant equipped. There are two points where this COULD have mattered, but when I reloaded and tried the same cutscenes without the pendant, they played the clips as if I still had it around my neck. Oh, and at one point you get a move that destroys the pendant when you use it for the first time, so it seems like using this skill again without the little protective cross charm as a shield might lead to a bad end or something, right? But no, it means absolutely nothing. It just gives you an excuse to need to get it repaired if you want to see the second and third endings. The skill is kind of worthless anyway since it's the only skill with both a cooldown and a windup time, making your other skills more effective at their specific jobs.

Point number 3: The gameplay is insultingly easy. I don't even think that's an exaggeration. I was kind of insulted by the non-boss gameplay since it is impossible to die unless you are REALLY REALLY trying to. Even then, you need to be far enough in the game that trying to die isn't going to kill something, level you up, and refill your health (basically you need to find one of those completely stationary minibosses and go ape on them with no armor if you want to die).

Both point 2 and point 3 were overshadowed by the first one though since they may just amount to nitpicking and I really did like the characters. However...

point number 4: Why am I not recommending this game? To say it without spoilers: I HATE the way it ended.
To say it with minor spoilers:  I didn't like a single one of the game's three endings
To actally explain myself fully: SERIOUSLY!? You give me a game with enjoyable characters and heartwarming/heartwrenching plot and then you have the balls to 1) force me into a bad end the first time through before unlocking a second pathway which was inacessible the first time around that I have to reload a save to take and 2) give me two endings that are arguably WORSE than that forced bad end!? Full disclosure here about what the endings are: End 1, both girls lose the majority of their will, but spend eternity together under this strange power remaining with just enough of themselves to be shown holding hands even when faced with a lifetime of nothing else. End 2, both girls die; plain and simple. End 3, The older sister sacrifices herself for the younger sister AGAIN, and the younger sister decides that she's going to go on journey to find and save her AGAIN, giving me the impression that the two of them will spend eternity apart repeating the same mistakes whenever they have a chance to reunite. These two girls have an immense amount of love between them, so if the alternatives are going to be dying together or facing separate hardships forever wihout each other to rely on, then I would certainly say the choice of spending eternity together in a tower they can't leave is far preferable.
Put bluntly. This game left a very bad taste in my mouth.

reviewText:
tl;dr It's cute but don't enable difficult mode.

Pros:
• Easy-to-use interface.
• Pretty fun.
• Has an inoffensive grindy element. It's kind of nice to have just a bit of grinding, and optional at that.
• Retro pixely art. Cute? so I'm told.
• A story - I'm not particularly keen on the actual story, but it is present and done pretty well.

Cons:
• Difficulty is poorly designed. The game offers hard mode. If you leave that off, then difficulty is effectively disabled and you can walk through the story. If you turn it on, however, the difficulty curve is not a curve, it's a few disjoint straight lines. It goes directly from riciulously simple button mashing for most of the game, through two bosses that actually offer some difficulty, to the final boss. The final fight itself allows no mistakes, past the halfway mark.
• Boss design in general feels more like you're just supposed to die a few times to get it. I prefer trying to stay on my toes, and don't think dying should be a functional part of the game. We're not dropping quarters in the thing, after all.
• When an enemy attack is visually sort-of ambiguous, the game gives you a warning by drawing a red impact-zone box. Maybe those attacks could just be less ambiguous, but the warnings really do work. That is, when they are there. Some attacks don't havei t, and they are ... surprising in a bad way. If the game designers want us to expect a warning, then they should give it to us, and not take it away like we've been bad and need to be punished.
• Outside of these warnings, there just aren't enough visual cues that I could find so where stay on your toes and guess what's coming" works. The visuals are pretty
date: but the actual gameplay gets lost in them sometimes.\n• Teeny tiny little gameplay window

reviewText: This is a truly awful game. Even though it's free, you shouldn't waste your time.  I completed the game when I had little else to do and was without internet. There is no combat system. You walk up to an enemy, you auto attack..and it's nothing but walking foward. This is highlighted by the very first boss battle. A dragon that sits in one places, shooting a fireball straight forward. You move to its side, or behind it, and just walk forward at it until it dies. The writing is cringeworthy, the story is basic, and dear lord, the music might be the worst thing about the game. Repetetive 30-40 second loops that absolutely do not fit the mood of the setting. The first moments of game play have you listening to cheery, upbeat music (which, by the way has some god-awful buzzing in the background) while you're questign to save your sister from the clutches of..monsters. Really...really awful.

reviewText: This is about as basic as RPG Maker games get. No one else has a reason to touch Eternal Senia.

I'm only 16 minutes in at the time of writing this but I don't see how a game like this could have such a high postive rating. The game so far has been:
-A hallway in which I fight easy one hit enemies.
-A convenient and poorly writen plot device that makes the sword break for no good reason, followed by your armor breaking for no good reason shortly after.
-Puzzles that could be solved by a moderately intelligent rodent.
-Default backstory A (A story severely lacking creativity and originality)
-Translation by someone with a poor grasp of the english language (or an 8 year old)
-Terrain design that looks like a first draft attempt from someone who's never made a game before
-Gameplay that could potentially become more complex but so far is basic and boring

This game looks like the first RPG I ever made on RPG maker 2003 (aka bad)
But at least you get your moneys worth LOL

reviewText:
Pros: It's easy and best if used as a time killer.

Cons: The game play is stale. There is little to no variety. At best you can upgrade a set number of skills or craft a set amount of stuff. That is it. And the 'fighting' is just you walking into enemies. Not very riviting -_-. The fighting is most exciting during the boss battles, though no matter what all you do is run into them and occasionally push a button. That's it. The bosses [with the exception of the last one] don't move at all, and the damage zone is thin. Playing it on hard makes me more frustrated than anything else. The story is also kinda dull and I just don't care at all about these characters. I'm just not interested enough to try and find the other endings.

Biggest complaint: This game NEEDS a map for the levels. I cannot tell you how easy it is to get turned around or miss something in this game. Especially at the end.

Final Verdict: This game has a heavy reliance on grinding and playing areas over and over. Now I'm a grinding kinda guy. I'll stick to an area to get stronger if I can. But I have no desire to do so here. This isn't a problem in games like the Dragon Quest franchise because the story is still interesting and you WANT to know what is going to happen to the characters. Plus most of those games provide variety depending on the game. This is just one example but my point stands. You don't care about the story, the gameplay is dull, the music doesn't change [though its lulaby tone fits fine], and while the art is pretty it isn't enough to pull this game through.

reviewText: Wow.... this game is just wow... the story is amazing and the endings are impactful.  A must try and playthrough for all anime fans and the game itself is incredibly easy.  The story is great and the boss battles actually require some skill and thinking in order to continue onwards.  I think this game deserves a solid 9/10 at least based off of story alone.  Perhaps if it were to ever be made and adapted into a huge game, this would be 10/10.  This game is also free, there is no reason for anyone to not try and play through it.  The entire playthrough takes about 90 minutes to 2 hours.  I played a bit longer to unlock the additional endings since I missed unlocking stuff for them :S

reviewText:
Play this game, it's good...
Seriously, very well made, lots of secrets and snippets to find and a quick and clean battle system.
Controller-calibration would be nice and sometimes the translation feels a bit spotty but that can be overlooked.
That being said: The story is heartbreaking and will abuse your emotions constantly. This is one of the most unrelentingly sad games I have yet to play and it makes the entire AAA-industry with its Press X to pay respect" look like a monkey who had a pen stuck between it's buttcheeks.
Prepare to cry but play it"

reviewText: It's a wonderful game designed for people wanting something simple (gameplay) as a change of pace. The graphics are decent for being an RPG-maker platform and the story is okay". I say this because the endings left something to be desired--to avoid spoilers. The battles were fairly easy until the very end when rage-mode kicks in and finding yourself dying every few minutes unless you're familiar with "bullet-hell" style games (to which this wouldn't be a problem).\n\nAt first glance
date: it looked like another lame anime RPG-clone that's been done to death (e.g. most flash MMORPG who use anime as ad and in reality looks nothing like it in actual gameplay) especially considering it's free which is what I was looking for so I decided to check it out anyway--nothing to lose except time. I was pleasantly surprised to find that I was enjoying myself. I enjoyed the simplicity in movements and attacking. No real skill needed which was a nice change.\n\nAll in all
recommended: I recommend this for the more "casual" players or players wanting to take a break from the skill-required games."

reviewText: A good game, with a great soundtrack and excellent pacing. The story is compelling and great, also the main character is full of compation for others and challenges the tower to search for her sister. I give this game the note of 8/10, personal rating. I loved the mechanics for the fights and how you have to search for everything just to get the best equipement. The puzzles in this game are not hard and the hints on how to solve them are really helpfull. Overall this game is great to play if you want to relax or enjoy a story that will make you feel THE feels. No matter who you are I suggest you give this game a chance. To me the game has become a gem like no others, also it is nice to take a break from other FPS games and others triple A games.

This game is great.
I actually cried when I choose those different endings

It beat the crud out of your masculinity

I heard that the game's going to get a sequel.
Recommended for whoever doesn't cry for 6 years like I did.
But my masculinity has been shattered because of this game.
Thanks.

reviewText: There's a lot to talk about this game, but let's just focus on the most important things. The story of the game is just great, it's rather short but deep. It's kinda sad at the end but that's the main purpose of it I suppose. The combat system and boss fights are fairly unique, not commonly seen in RPG games. The music really fits the game, it creates a nice mood. The art is well drawn.The last but not least, the gameplay itself is not borring, it's rather gripping, making you to continute playing. Overall I think the game is extremely well made, and could be easily compared to games with a much much higher budged. I enjoyed every second of gameplay of this game.

reviewText:
tl;dr
It's free, fun, has a great story, and is just overall really well done. You lose no more than a few minutes of your time and a couple MB of space for giving this a try, so why not go for it?

This game is absolute quality. If the 98% positive rating (at time of writing) and big FREE button don't convince you to get this and at least try it, maybe I can give you that last little push.

Eternal Senia is incredibly simple and quick to pick up, but by no means is it boring or too easy. Combat revolves around walking into things or using Q, W, E, and R to dash, slam, and slice your enemies. On the first few mobs you fight, it's all about dealing some damage while taking some, restoring hp, and repeating. Once you fight your first boss though, and enter into the later levels, things start to get more complex with AoE hitboxes, projectiles, invincibility, stuns, etc. You'll find things to be incredibly difficult unless you go craft yourself the best armor and weapons around. Even then though, you can always bump it up to hard mode to really screw yourself over.

As for leveling, you get xp from killing things which of course levels you up, but it has less of a role in this game than it does in most other RPGs. In Eternal Senia, you get stronger by crafting better equipment and by leveling your abilities with skill points gained from killing things . Leveling alone will get you nowhere. Fear not though, as the crafting system is also incredibly simple and easy with the classic upgrade" mechanic. Build your weapon
date: then gather materials to upgrade it 3 times. Same goes for the rest of your equipment.\n\n"Great
hoursPlayed: but who cares? I'm one of those people who only cares about atmosphere!"\nWell
voteText: Eternal Senia has got that covered too. The story is a real tear jerker if you can ignore the 10 or so translation errors
helpfulPercent: and the soundtrack is absolutely beautiful. There's also 3 different endings
votesHelpful: each of which is incredibly well done. It's not like Mass Effect 3
votesTotal: where options A and B are for if you suck at the game and only option C is good.\n\nOverall
votesFunny: for being free
commentsCount: this game goes above and beyond any expectations. I'm actually glad the developer took that route

There are multiple endings, there is a crafting system, there are a lot of stuff that's worth spending your time in it.
10/10 woul play it so what are you waiting for,
JUST DO IT. DON'T LET YOUR DREAMS BE DREAMS. PLAY IT.

reviewText:
I'll admit, I was not to fond of the game at first, but after the first 15 mins at most, it gets to be quite the amazing game.
The story: Heart Warming and Heart Breaking
Combat: Simple yet quite fun
Graphics: A bit finiky and glitchy at times, but pretty good artwork and well done pixelated graphics
Music: Pretty good, nothing way to outstanding, but it is very nice to listen to.

Overall Grade:9/10, a few kinks to work out, but what rpg maker game doesn't.
